relevant_communication:
February: Side-Event during CGRFA 16 about Access and Benefit Sharing of Animal Genetic Resources: Community Protocols and Other Perspectives 
(March:)  Support and Development of the First Camel Diary in Sadri, India 
April: Presentation on Biocultural Community Protocols at Pastoralist Knowledge Hub Partner’s Meeting / Rome, Italy 
May: Panel Discussion on Livestock Keeping in Fischbachtal /Germany 
September: Writeshop to develop Guidelines for Biocultural Community Protocols in Butibagh/Rajasthan India 
November: Marwar Camel Festival and Development of BCP of Camel Breeders of Rajasthan, India 
November: Organic World Conference, Delhi, India: Participation in a fishbowl discussion on “The Global Food System and the Alternative Paradigm”
goals__remit:
Through research, positions papers, advocacy and action, critically adressing issues concerning : 
-smallholders and pastoralists all over the world with the goal to support a sustainable way of life that feeds a large part of the poorest people in the world by livestock keeping  
-industrialisation of agricultural production. Finding alternative concepts of the future of livestock keeping and agricultural heritage and sustainability. Decentralisation of animal keeping to make use of local resources 
-livestock keepers´ rights. Marketing and value-addition of local livestock production/fair prices and infrastructure 
-animal welfare and healthy food
